## Description {#details}

This file defines the BumpPtrAllocator interface.

BumpPtrAllocator conforms to the LLVM &quot;Allocator&quot; concept and is similar to MallocAllocator, but objects cannot be deallocated. Their lifetime is tied to the lifetime of the allocator.

<SectionDefinition>

<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Allocate memory in an ever growing pool, as if by bump-pointer.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This isn&#39;t strictly a bump-pointer allocator as it uses backing slabs of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// memory rather than relying on a boundless contiguous heap. However, it has</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// bump-pointer semantics in that it is a monotonically growing pool of memory</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// where every allocation is found by merely allocating the next N bytes in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the slab, or the next N bytes in the next slab.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Note that this also has a threshold for forcing allocations above a certain</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// size into their own slab.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The BumpPtrAllocatorImpl template defaults to using a MallocAllocator</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// object, which wraps malloc, to allocate memory, but it can be changed to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// use a custom allocator.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The GrowthDelay specifies after how many allocated slabs the allocator</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// increases the size of the slabs.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> AllocatorT = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mallocallocator">MallocAllocator</a>, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> SlabSize = 4096,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Deallocate all but the current slab and reset the current pointer</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bumpptrallocatorimpl/#a977c94ac0ef5e305e5cf40726351d88a"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bumpptrallocatorimpl/#a977c94ac0ef5e305e5cf40726351d88a">Reset</a>() &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Deallocate all but the first slab, and deallocate all custom-sized slabs.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><span class="doxyHighlight">    DeallocateCustomSizedSlabs();</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Reset the state.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Allocate space at the specified alignment.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This method is &#42;not&#42; marked noalias, because</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// SpecificBumpPtrAllocator::DestroyAll() loops over all allocations, and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// that loop is not based on the Allocate() return value.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Allocate(0, N) is valid, it returns a non-null pointer (which should not</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bumpptrallocatorimpl/#a4054c3eefe873caf49c2290808d409ac"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/compiler-h/#acbae7c06e77fa64145cca176963b6863">LLVM&#95;ATTRIBUTE&#95;RETURNS&#95;NONNULL</a> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bumpptrallocatorimpl/#a4054c3eefe873caf49c2290808d409ac">Allocate</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a>, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> Alignment) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Keep track of how many bytes we&#39;ve allocated.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><span class="doxyHighlight">    BytesAllocated += <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><span class="doxyHighlight">    uintptr&#95;t AlignedPtr = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#afff5074588f0423a669618a7134e13ec">alignAddr</a>(CurPtr, Alignment);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Add trailing bytes as a &quot;red zone&quot; under ASan.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><span class="doxyHighlight">    uintptr&#95;t AllocEndPtr = AlignedPtr + SizeToAllocate;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(AllocEndPtr &gt;= uintptr&#95;t(CurPtr) &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Check if we have enough space.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/compiler-h/#ae5b35beb6f127e5f47269e9124b886fb">LLVM&#95;LIKELY</a>(AllocEndPtr &lt;= uintptr&#95;t(End)</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Update the allocation point of this memory block in MemorySanitizer.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="181"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/compiler-h/#acbae7c06e77fa64145cca176963b6863">LLVM&#95;ATTRIBUTE&#95;RETURNS&#95;NONNULL</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/compiler-h/#ac6a5e0eb6a9944baf6ba14b640eab6e1">LLVM&#95;ATTRIBUTE&#95;NOINLINE</a> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="182" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bumpptrallocatorimpl/#aef3aaf3bf7c0ec3ad8ad4941b14bb846"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bumpptrallocatorimpl/#aef3aaf3bf7c0ec3ad8ad4941b14bb846">AllocateSlow</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a>, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> SizeToAllocate, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> Alignment) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="184"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> PaddedSize = SizeToAllocate + Alignment.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align/#a80735739b49cf97a491922c8f9af2cc1">value</a>() - 1;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="185"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (PaddedSize &gt; SizeThreshold) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="191"><span class="doxyHighlight">      CustomSizedSlabs.push&#95;back(std::make&#95;pair(NewSlab, PaddedSize));</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="198"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> AlignedPtr;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="199"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Otherwise, start a new slab and try again.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00271" /><CodeLine lineNumber="271"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// A wrapper around identifyKnownObject. Accepts type information</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00272" /><CodeLine lineNumber="272"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// about the object and produces a smaller identifier by relying on</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00273" /><CodeLine lineNumber="273"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the alignment information. Note that sub-classes may have different</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00274" /><CodeLine lineNumber="274"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// alignment, so the most base class should be passed as template parameter</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00275" /><CodeLine lineNumber="275"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// in order to obtain correct results. For that reason automatic template</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00276" /><CodeLine lineNumber="276"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// parameter deduction is disabled.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00277" /><CodeLine lineNumber="277"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\return An index uniquely and reproducibly identifying</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00278" /><CodeLine lineNumber="278"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// an input pointer \\p Ptr in the given allocator. This identifier is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00279" /><CodeLine lineNumber="279"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// different from the ones produced by identifyObject and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00280" /><CodeLine lineNumber="280"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// identifyAlignedObject.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00281" /><CodeLine lineNumber="281"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> T&gt;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="328"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The number of bytes to put between allocations when running under</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="329"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// a sanitizer.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="330"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> RedZoneSize = 1;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="331"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="332"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> computeSlabSize(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> SlabIdx) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="333"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Scale the actual allocated slab size based on the number of slabs</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="334"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// allocated. Every GrowthDelay slabs allocated, we double</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="335"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the allocated size to reduce allocation frequency, but saturate at</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="336"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// multiplying the slab size by 2^30.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="337"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> SlabSize &#42;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="338"><span class="doxyHighlight">           ((size&#95;t)1 &lt;&lt; std::min&lt;size&#95;t&gt;(30, SlabIdx / GrowthDelay));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="339"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="340"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="341"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Allocate a new slab and move the bump pointers over into the new</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00383" /><CodeLine lineNumber="383"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00384" /><CodeLine lineNumber="384"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// A BumpPtrAllocator that allows only elements of a specific type to be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00385" /><CodeLine lineNumber="385"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// allocated.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00386" /><CodeLine lineNumber="386"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00387" /><CodeLine lineNumber="387"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This allows calling the destructor in DestroyAll() and when the allocator is</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00389" /><CodeLine lineNumber="389" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/specificbumpptrallocator"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> T&gt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/specificbumpptrallocator/#aa0b260cceae282bd1a0cb3976ba72c88">SpecificBumpPtrAllocator</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
